Protein Work & Research Focus

A snapshot of my main research themes around protein dynamics, modeling, and epitope design.

Gradations in Protein Dynamics

Thesis & ongoing work

I analyze large datasets of proteins with paired AlphaFold models and experimental ensembles (NMR / MD) to detect regions with high RMSF, ambiguous secondary structure, and cryptic flexibility. My goal is to understand how these gradations in dynamics relate to function and binding.

This includes eigenvector-based analysis (PCA), RMSF/S² calculations, and integration of pLDDT and secondary structure features into predictive models.

Epitope-focused Mini-protein Design

Computational design & ddG analysis

I use epitope-engineering strategies and molecular modeling tools (Rosetta / PyRosetta) to design mini-proteins that recapitulate key conformational epitopes, including subdominant ones, for therapeutic antibody discovery.

This involves scanning mutations, computing ddG values, and exploring how local flexibility and conformational heterogeneity affect binding.

GitHub Projects

A selection of code and tools I maintain. Replace the placeholder links below with your actual repositories.

protein-ensemble-tools

Scripts and utilities for analyzing protein ensembles (NMR / MD), computing RMSF, S², PCA, and comparing AlphaFold predictions with experimental flexibility profiles.

View on GitHub →

flexibility-ml

Prototype deep learning models that take sequence and structural features as input and predict residue-wise flexibility and dynamic states.

View on GitHub →

epitope-miniprotein-design

Workflows and example scripts for epitope-focused mini-protein design, including Rosetta / PyRosetta protocols and ddG analysis.

View on GitHub →
